title: Whats the catch?
body: that extra 0.33% movement speed costs 2049 more IP.... what?

replies.body:
No catch.

Tier 2 runes were permanently discounted to 1IP each so that newer players didn't have to go into games with incomplete or unideal rune pages. Obviously it's beneficial to get the tier 3s eventually, but the tier 2s act as a way to get players into games without that massive disadvantage, and without having to spend all their IP on runes instead of buying champs they want to try.

I have been playing for 4 years, have 120000 IP and i was still debating which ones to buy haha, that discount is redic. xD hahaha

bought the more expensive ones in the end....

If you've got the IP it's always worth to buy the tier 3. I've got all the champs I want so I'm slowly expanding my rune collection and just keeping enough for icons/new champs that come out.

It's worth noting I don't know where exactly the rune limit is. I know it lets you buy all of the tier 3 runes and some over, but I'm not sure how many, so anyone who buys tier 2 runes may have to ticket support to get some/all removed at some point.
Rune limit is 3 quints and 9 of the other types of the same runes if thats what you meant?
Negative, seras is referring to the hard limit imposed on the total overall amount of runes you can have on your account.
Oops my mistake, good catch. Fixed.
I wish it wasnt a mistake... 1.5 % is pretty scabby for 2k ip
